phase_prompt: We have previously created content in the following formats:
Articles: Long-form written content that provides in-depth information on a topic.
Infographics: Visual representations of information, data, or knowledge intended to present information quickly and clearly.
Videos: Recorded visual footages that convey messages or present information.
Podcasts: Audio programs distributed digitally, discussing various topics of interest.
Webinars: Online events or presentations delivered in real-time to an audience over the internet.
Case Studies: In-depth examinations of a particular situation or occurrence, providing insights or demonstrating effectiveness.
Tutorials: Step-by-step guides to teach the audience how to achieve something specific.
Given the audience data and requirements: '{task}', what is the most suitable content format?

Note that we must ONLY discuss the content format and do not discuss anything else! Once we all have expressed our opinion(s) and agree with the results of the discussion unanimously, any of us must actively terminate the discussion by replying with only one line, which starts with a single word <INFO>, followed by our final product modality without any other words, e.g., "<INFO> PowerPoint".
